channel.title: Creativebug - Kids
channel.description: Young crafters are our favorite crafters, and this section is specially set up just for them. Get started on anything that captures your imaginationâ€”you can build a teepee, make a puppet theater, dye yarn with Kool-Aid, or become an illustrator, all in a single weekend. Why not? But be warned: when taking these classes, you may just stumble upon a secret hidden talent that will alter the course of your life (or at least your weekends).

item.title: Customized Play Tent: 1/10/2017
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney demonstrates how to make a fold-up A-Frame play tent using customized fabric from Jo-Ann Fabric and Craft Stores! This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 10, 2017.

item.title: Creative Napkin Folding: 12/22/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Learn fancy ways to fold cloth napkins with Courtney and Julie.This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 22, 2016.

item.title: Matchbox Advent Calendar: 11/29/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Get ready for the holidays with Courtney as she shows you how to make an advent calendar out of matchboxes. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on November 29, 2016.

item.title: Adding Duplicate Stitch to Knits
item.author: Marly Bird
item.description: Learn how to add customized monograms to your knits with the magic of duplicate stitch. Marly Bird shows you how this simple hand-sewn stitch is applied to knitted fabric, mimicking the knit stitches in order to create a seamless embellishment. Best of all, this stitch can be added to any finished knitting, so you can choose to embellish your project even after you’ve bound off. Downloadable PDF with monogram charts included with class.

item.title: Stress Balls: 11/8/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Make simple stress balls using balloons, cornstarch, and water. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on November 8, 2016.

item.title: Haunted Gingerbread House: 10/25/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Make Halloween is spooky and sweet with this candy-coated haunted gingerbread house. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on October 25, 2016.

item.title: Crocheted Hair Clips: 9/13/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Twinkie Chan and Courtney Cerruti show us how to make adorable hair clips by gluing crocheted fruit to barrettes. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on September 13, 2016.

item.title: Marbled Oreo Cookies: 9/8/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Customize cookies using Wilton candy melts with this marbled-effect dip technique by Courtney Cerruti. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on September 8, 2016.

item.title: Fabric and Pompom Backdrop: 9/1/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney shows you how to make a stunning party backdrop using fabric strips and tissue paper pompoms. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on September 1, 2016.

item.title: Bubble Prints: 8/23/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Faith Hale shows us how to make super cool prints using bubbles and food coloring or ink. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on August 23, 2016.

item.title: Stenciled Wall Decor and Doodled Shoes: 8/18/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Learn how to make stenciled wall décor and doodled shoes with supplies from Michaels Stores. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on August 18, 2016.

item.title: Back-to-School Totes: 8/6/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: In this Back-to-School "Haul" video, Courtney Cerruti shows you how to customize a kid-friendly tote or book bag, all made with supplies from Michaels. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on August 6, 2016.

item.title: Homemade PB&J Cups: 8/4/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Liana shows you how to make peanut butter and jelly cups at home. Yum! To make these you will need: 3 cups chocolate chips, 1 cup peanut butter, 1 "sleeve" of graham crackers, 1 cup powdered sugar, and a jar of jam. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on August 4, 2016.

item.title: DIY Valentine's Day Love Bugs
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Get crafty with the little ones this Valentine’s Day with this fun and simple project. Courtney Cerruti shows you how to make love bugs using pipe cleaners, pompoms and googly eyes. These bugs take no time to make, and are great to hand out as little gifts or to stick onto Valentine cards.

item.title: Loom Knitting: Make a Hat
item.author: Michele of Simplicity
item.description: If you love the look of knitted fabric but don’t feel like picking up your knitting needles, try your hand at loom knitting. This style of knitting is super fast and fun for all ages—plus you can learn how to use the loom in a snap. Michele Muska teaches you how to use a round loom to knit two types of hats: one with a rolled brim and the other with a flat brim. For extra flourish, Michele shows you how to create a faux fur pompom to attach to the top of the hat.

item.title: Frida Kahlo Inspired Headband
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Frida Kahlo inspires us through her art, but her iconic flower headbands are pretty inspirational, too. Courtney demonstrates how to create a flower headband featuring custom-made felt flowers that pop. This piece is great for Halloween, Dia de los Muertos, Cinco de Mayo or any celebration that requires some bold, bright headwear.

item.title: DIY Fox Mask
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Get into character in a jiffy with this fun, no-sew fox mask. Courtney shows how to use a template to cut and assemble the felt mask, and explains how it can be sized for partygoers of all ages. Grab a fedora and a slick suit and your sly fox costume is complete.

item.title: DIY Mouse Mask
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: The adorable no-sew felt mouse mask is great for assembling a last minute mouse costume. Courtney shows how to use a template to cut and assemble this simple mask, and discusses how create it in a variety of colors and sizes for costume wearers of all ages.

item.title: DIY Raccoon Mask
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Creating a great costume is simple with this quick raccoon mask tutorial. Courtney demonstrates how to use a template to cut and assemble the felt mask – no sewing skills needed. In no time you will be transformed into a furry little bandit.

item.title: DIY Tiger Mask
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Transform into the king or queen of the jungle with this fast and ferocious tiger mask. Courtney demonstrates how to use a template to cut and assemble a simple, no-sew mask, which can be created in a variety of sizes and colors for jungle cats of all ages.

item.title: Quick and Easy Bird Costume
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description:
Outfit yourself with colorful plumage this Halloween. Courtney demonstrates how to create a feather-covered cape and matching mask. This no-sew bird costume is simple and easy to make, and it can be customized for feathered friends of all ages.

Learn how to:
· Cut and paint a colorful canvas wing base and attach ribbon closure
· Cut and attach felt feathers in a variety of sizes
· Make a bird face mask and attach ribbon closure

item.title: DIY Room DÃ©cor: Painted Fabric Wall Art
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Learn how to transform painted cotton fabric into bold, abstract wall décor. Using expressive brush strokes in a color palette of your choice, Courtney Cerruti shows you how to paint abstractly on fabric, then “frame” your painted fabric in embroidery hoops. The finished pieces are lightweight and super easy to hang – perfect for sprucing up a bedroom or making any space your own.

item.title: DIY Room DÃ©cor: Color-Blocked Bulletin Board
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Learn how to turn a basic cork panel into a colorful, decorative bulletin board in a snap. Courtney Cerruti shows you how to paint a color-blocked design on cork and add a colorful rope hanger. She then shows you how to spruce up your pushpins by attaching colorful pompoms and paper flowers with hot glue. Hang your finished corkboard in your kitchen or bedroom â€“ itâ€™s perfect for displaying your favorite photos and inspirational imagery.

item.title: DIY Dream Catcher
item.author: Emily Katz
item.description: MacramÃ© artist Emily Katz demonstrates how to weave a modern version of the classic dream catcher. Learn how to create an overall web design, and then personalize your project by incorporating found objects and treasured keepsakes. Once youâ€™re done, hang your dream catcher over your bed to ward off bad dreams, or display it in your home as a piece of art.

item.title: Sketchbook Explorations
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description: The habit of keeping a sketchbook is an important exercise, whether you are deepening your artistic practice or starting a brand new one. In this series, Lisa Congdon delves into her personal practice, sharing techniques that she employs in her own mixed media sketchbook. Best of all, you won’t be limited to one medium. Lisa explores ways to incorporate pen, watercolor, collage, brush pens, and more, allowing you to play with techniques that go beyond your comfort zone. As Lisa tells you “Just let go of the fear and dive in.”

item.title: Sketchbook Explorations
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description: The habit of keeping a sketchbook is an important exercise, whether you are deepening your artistic practice or starting a brand new one. In this series, Lisa Congdon delves into her personal practice, sharing techniques that she employs in her own mixed media sketchbook. Best of all, you won’t be limited to one medium. Lisa explores ways to incorporate pen, watercolor, collage, brush pens, and more, allowing you to play with techniques that go beyond your comfort zone. As Lisa tells you “Just let go of the fear and dive in.”

item.title: Sketchbook Explorations
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description: The habit of keeping a sketchbook is an important exercise, whether you are deepening your artistic practice or starting a brand new one. In this series, Lisa Congdon delves into her personal practice, sharing techniques that she employs in her own mixed media sketchbook. Best of all, you won’t be limited to one medium. Lisa explores ways to incorporate pen, watercolor, collage, brush pens, and more, allowing you to play with techniques that go beyond your comfort zone. As Lisa tells you “Just let go of the fear and dive in.”

item.title: Sketchbook Explorations
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description: The habit of keeping a sketchbook is an important exercise, whether you are deepening your artistic practice or starting a brand new one. In this series, Lisa Congdon delves into her personal practice, sharing techniques that she employs in her own mixed media sketchbook. Best of all, you won’t be limited to one medium. Lisa explores ways to incorporate pen, watercolor, collage, brush pens, and more, allowing you to play with techniques that go beyond your comfort zone. As Lisa tells you “Just let go of the fear and dive in.”

item.title: AppliquÃ© Umbrella
item.author: Nicole Blum
item.description: Turn your kidâ€™s drawings and designs into a snazzy umbrella with this project, which is sort of like creating custom stickers from nylon. Nicole and her son show how to use a few simple materials to fancy up an umbrella and brighten any dreary day. This works for kids of all ages.

item.title: Sew a Felt Sewing Kit
item.author: Annabel Wrigley
item.description: Learn how to create a colorful, travel-sized sewing kit with Annabel of Little Pincushion Studio. This simple sewing project uses a pattern template for cutting out felt pieces, and the sewing instructions are easy for new sewists to follow. Fill your kit with sewing supplies and you will be ready to stitch on the go.

item.title: Beginning Watercolor
item.author: Yao Cheng
item.description: This two-part foundation course is a perfect entry point for beginners, providing a basic understanding of how to paint successfully with watercolors. Yao begins the course by introducing artists to the array of colors everyone should have in their palette, and shows how to mix and apply pigment to paper. From there, she goes on to explain the uses of specific paintbrushes and demonstrates how to make beautiful expressive marks to create leaves, trees, and simple geometric shapes.

item.title: Beginning Watercolor
item.author: Yao Cheng
item.description: This two-part foundation course is a perfect entry point for beginners, providing a basic understanding of how to paint successfully with watercolors. Yao begins the course by introducing artists to the array of colors everyone should have in their palette, and shows how to mix and apply pigment to paper. From there, she goes on to explain the uses of specific paintbrushes and demonstrates how to make beautiful expressive marks to create leaves, trees, and simple geometric shapes.

item.title: Hand Sew Farm Animal Finger Puppets
item.author: Kata Golda
item.description: Learn how to make a whole gang of farm animal finger puppets with Alison of Kata Golda. Templates are included to make a dog, cat, pig, chick, and bunny, and each finger puppet is made the same way – with two pieces of felt and a few simple stitches. But the cute hand-stitched faces and little details are what give each farm animal their distinctive traits. Alison shares tips for free-hand stitching the features, and demonstrates how to sew the front to the back with blanket stitch.

item.title: Sew an Easter Bunny Basket
item.author: Annabel Wrigley
item.description: This sturdy and adorable bunny-themed Easter basket is a must-have accessory for any Easter Egg hunt. Made with natural-colored canvas and pink felt, this basket features a stitched bunny face and big floppy ears. Once you’ve attached the pompom tail, your basket is ready to fill with treats and treasures.

item.title: DIY Easter Bunny Ears
item.author: Annabel Wrigley
item.description: Learn how to create cute Easter Bunny ears using wire and colorful fabric. Easy and fun to make, this craft is great for a children’s party activity. Make a whole set of bunny ears in different colors and sizes to wear at a family gathering, or use them as a photo booth prop.

item.title: Create a Colorful Abstract Painting
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: You donâ€™t need to consider yourself a painter to create this colorful work of art. Courtney introduces you to a bold way of applying color to a canvas that results in this bright, abstract field of color. Courtney talks you through how to create a cohesive palette, then evaluate and build your work of art until you determine that itâ€™s ready to grace your walls with its confident swaths of color.

item.title: Felt Flower Headband
item.author: Annabel Wrigley
item.description: This pretty and sweet adornment adds a midsummer night's feel to any season. Working with felt in bright color combinations creates a wearable bouquet of plush happiness – but you can equally create a bracelet, garlands, or decorate the edge of a lampshade. Beads add texture to the bohemian feel of this project.

item.title: How to Make a Pom Pom
item.author: Maggie Pace
item.description: Learn three different ways to make pompoms with knitwear designer Maggie Pace. You will learn how to make pompoms using a store-bought pompom maker, or make your own pompom maker out of cardboard. Also included are instructions on making tiny pompoms using a fork.

item.title: Glitter 101
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Learn everything there is to know about glitter in this quick (and sparkly) class. Courtney Cerruti demonstrates the proper way to apply glitter to glue, and best practices for getting the excess back in the jar. All types of glitter are covered here, from kids craft glitters, to specialty crushed glass, and spray paint.

item.title: Halloween Party DÃ©cor
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: This class is jam-packed with six different Halloween craft projects that range from gothic and bookish to add a slightly sinister note to an adult cocktail party to paper decorations and Halloween surprise balls that will enliven any kids’ party. Use these ideas as a jumping-off point to customize your own Halloween decorations.
